instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: 829-00164 cycling
threads.message:
Previous work. Liquid damaged.

PPBUS = 8.6
3V42 = 3V42
S5 rails = 3v3 5v

All S4 S3 S0 rails (3v3, 5v, 1v05, 1v5, 1v2, 1v8, 0v6) cycling. Can't find a short. I'm guessing maybe Isense somewhere is bad?
I'm stuck on this one.

Sorry there is not much to go on

threads.title: 829-00164 cycling
threads.message:
Check for any pulse at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, pins 1, 7, 3.
Be sure it gets 3V at pin8.

threads.title: 829-00164 cycling
threads.message: The usual <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>/<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> traces/resistors, J6100, crap under SMC.
